description: After two weeks of talks, EU finance ministers have agreed on a package to help countries hit by Covid-19.
title: Coronavirus: Are EU divisions banished after the deal?
title_page: Coronavirus: Are EU divisions banished after the deal? - BBC News
maintext: Germany may no longer be taking the lead in trying to find or force solutions to EU crises, but it has been lauded and applauded for taking in Covid-19 patients from Italy and France and for sending ventilators to the UK. Romania is one of a number of countries sending teams of doctors and nurses to other EU nations in need of help.
